__comment__: This file was automatically created by mcresources
name: Ores and Minerals

pages.text: Ores and Minerals in TFC are rare - unlike Vanilla, ores are found in massive, sparse, yet rare veins that require some $(l:mechanics/prospecting)prospecting$() to locate. Different ores will also appear in different rock types, and at different elevations, meaning finding the right rock type at the right elevation is key to locating the ore you are looking for.

In addition, some ores are $(thing)Graded$(). Ore blocks may be Poor, Normal, or Rich, and different veins will have different concentrations of each type of block. Veins that are $(thing)richer$() are more lucrative.$(br2)The next several pages show the different types of ores, what they look like, and where to find them.

Native Copper is an ore of $(thing)Copper$() metal. It can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_extrusive)Igneous Extrusive$() rocks, at elevations above y=40.$(br2)It can also be found in deposits in $(thing)rivers$(), which can be $(l:mechanics/panning)panned$().
pages.title: Native Copper

pages.text: Native Copper Ores in Dacite.

Native Gold is an ore of $(thing)Gold$() metal. It can be found at elevations below y=70, but deeper veins are larger and richer. It can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_extrusive)Igneous Extrusive$() and $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rocks.$(br2)It can also be found in deposits in $(thing)rivers$(), which can be $(l:mechanics/panning)panned$().
pages.title: Native Gold

pages.text: Native Gold Ores in Diorite.

Native Silver is an ore of $(thing)Silver$() metal. Small poor veins can be found in $(thing)Granite$() or $(thing)Diorite$() in uplift regions, above y=90. Larger and richer veins can be found in $(thing)Granite$(), $(thing)Diorite$(), $(thing)Schist$(), and $(thing)Gneiss$() deep underground below y=20.$(br2)It can also be found in deposits in $(thing)rivers$(), which can be $(l:mechanics/panning)panned$().
pages.title: Native Silver

pages.text: Native Silver Ores in Granite.
Tetrahedrite is an ore of $(thing)Copper$() metal. It can be found at any elevation, but deeper veins are often richer. It can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#metamorphic)Metamorphic$() rocks.
pages.title: Tetrahedrite

pages.text: Tetrahedrite Ores in Schist.

Malachite is an ore of $(thing)Copper$() metal. It can be found primarily in $(thing)Marble$() or $(thing)Limestone$(), $(thing)Chalk$(), and $(thing)Dolomite$(). It can be found at most elevations, however deeper veins are often larger and richer.
pages.title: Malachite

pages.text: Malachite Ores in Marble.

Cassiterite is an ore of $(thing)Tin$() metal. It can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rocks at high elevation, above y=80 in uplift regions or in dikes.$(br2)It can also be found in deposits in $(thing)rivers$(), which can be $(l:mechanics/panning)panned$().
pages.title: Cassiterite

pages.text: Cassiterite Ores in Diorite.

Bismuthinite is an ore of $(thing)Bismuth$() metal. It can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks near the surface, or larger and richer veins in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rocks deep underground.
pages.title: Bismuthinite

pages.text: Bismuthinite Ores in Shale.

Garnierite is an ore of $(thing)Nickel$() metal. It can be found at elevations below y=0. It can be found primarily in $(thing)Gabbro$() deep underground. Smaller, rarer veins can also be found in any $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rock.
pages.title: Garnierite

pages.text: Garnierite Ores in Gabbro.
Hematite is an ore of $(thing)Iron$() metal. It can be found in large veins in any $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_extrusive)Igneous Extrusive$() rocks near the surface.
pages.title: Hematite

pages.text: Hematite Ores in Andesite.
Magnetite is an ore of $(thing)Iron$() metal. It can be found in large veins in any $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks near the surface.
pages.title: Magnetite

pages.text: Magnetite Ores in Limestone.
Limonite is an ore of $(thing)Iron$() metal. It can be found in large veins in any $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks near the surface.
pages.title: Limonite

pages.text: Limonite Ores in Chalk.

Sphalerite is an ore of $(thing)Zinc$() metal. Small, poor veins can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_extrusive)Igneous Extrusive$() rocks near the surface, and large richer veins can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rocks deep underground.
pages.title: Sphalerite

pages.text: Sphalerite Ores in Quartzite.

pages.title: Lignite
pages.text: Lignite is a type of low-grade $(thing)Coal$() ore. It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks.
Lignite in Dolomite.

pages.title: Bituminous Coal
pages.text: Bituminous Coal is a type of mid-grade $(thing)Coal$() ore. It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks.
Bituminous Coal in Chert.

pages.title: Kaolin Clay
pages.text: Kaolinite is a soft $(thing)Mineral$() which is used in the construction of $(l:mechanics/fire_clay)Fire Clay$(). It can be found spawning at high altitudes in Plateaus, Old Mountains, and Highlands, at a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 18°C, with a $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 300mm. The $(thing)Blood Lily$() flower grows on Kaolin clay.
Variants of kaolin clay.

pages.title: Kaolinite
pages.text: Kaolinite, unlike Kaolin Clay, can be found regardless of climate. It can be rarely found in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks around sea level in very small veins, or in larger veins when the $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() is at least 18°C, with a $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 300mm. Like Kaolin, The $(thing)Blood Lily$() flower grows over Kaolinite deposits.
Kaolinite in Limestone.

pages.title: Graphite
pages.text: Graphite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which is used in the construction of $(l:mechanics/fire_clay)Fire Clay$(). It can be found in $(thing)Gneiss$(), $(thing)Marble$(), $(thing)Quartzite$(), and $(thing)Schist$() rocks, in elevations below y=60 or in very small veins above y=50.
Graphite in Gneiss.

pages.title: Kyanite
pages.text: Kyanite is found rarely in large crystals in any rock type deep underground near lava. Kyanite can be crushed into $(thing)Kyanite Powder$(), which is used to make $(thing)Refractory Bricks$(), necessary for the $(thing)Industrial Furnace$(), which enables $(thing)Titanium$() and $(thing)Tungsten$() processing.
A Kyanite Crystal.

pages.title: Ilmenite
pages.text: Ilmenite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be found in veins deep underground, in $(l:the_world/geology#metamorphic)Metamorphic$(), $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_extrusive)Igneous Extrusive$() and $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rocks in elevations below y=-16. It is used in the production of $(thing)Titanium$().
Ilmenite in Marble.

pages.title: Wolframite
pages.text: Wolframite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be found in veins deep underground, in $(thing)Granite$() and $(thing)Quartzite$() alongside $(l:the_world/ores_and_minerals#sphalerite)Sphalerite$() in elevations below y=-16. It is used in the production of $(thing)Tungsten$().
Wolframite in Granite.

pages.title: Cinnabar
pages.text: Cinnabar is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be ground in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$() to obtain $(thing)Redstone Dust$(). It can be found in veins deep underground, in $(thing)Quartzite$(), $(thing)Granite$(), $(thing)Phyllite$(), and $(thing)Schist$().
Cinnabar in Quartzite.

pages.title: Cryolite
pages.text: Cryolite is a $(thing)Mineral$() is used to make $(thing)Aluminum$() as a catalyst in a Blast Furnace with $(thing)Alumina Powder$(). It can be found in veins deep underground, in $(thing)Granite$(), and $(thing)Diorite$().
Cryolite in Granite.

pages.title: Saltpeter
pages.text: Saltpeter is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be ground in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$(), and then used in the crafting of $(thing)Gunpowder$(). It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks.
Saltpeter in Shale.

pages.title: Sulfur
pages.text: Sulfur is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be ground in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$(), and then used in the crafting of $(thing)Gunpowder$() and $(thing)Rubber. It is found near lava level deep underground, or in any volcanic biome at any height, in sparse but large and plentiful veins, in any $(l:the_world/geology#metamorphic)Metamorphic$() or $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rock.
Sulfur in Gabbro.

pages.title: Oil Shale
pages.text: Oil Shales are a special type of $(thing)Mineral$() which can be processed in a Pyrolyzer to obtain oil, which can be further distilled into Diesel, Kerosene, and Gasoline. It is found semi-deep underground, in sparse or large and plentiful flat veins, in $(thing)Shale$(), $(thing)Claystone$(), $(thing)Phyllite$() and $(thing)Slate$().
Oil in Shale.

pages.title: Manganite
pages.text: Manganite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be eventually processed into Manganese in a Blast Furnace, which is a ingredient for making $(thing)Mangalloy$(), a key ingredient for heavy armaments. It can be found around sea level in any rock on Lowlands.
Manganite in Gabbro.

pages.title: Rhodocrosite
pages.text: Rhodocrosite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be eventually processed into Manganese in a Blast Furnace, which is a ingredient for making $(thing)Mangalloy$(), a key ingredient for heavy armaments. It can be found mixed with $(thing)Native Silver$() or on it's own in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() or $(l:the_world/geology#metamorphic)Metamorphic$() rocks, below Y=70.
Rhodocrosite in Slate.

pages.title: Sylvite
pages.text: Sylvite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be ground in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$(), and then used as a $(l:mechanics/fertilizers)Fertilizer$(). It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(thing)Shale$(), $(thing)Claystone$() and $(thing)Chert$().
Sylvite in Chert.

pages.title: Borax
pages.text: Borax is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be ground in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$() to produce $(l:mechanics/flux)Flux$(). It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(thing)Claystone$(), $(thing)Limestone$(), and $(thing)Shale$().
Borax in Shale.

pages.title: Gypsum
pages.text: Gypsum is a decorative $(thing)Mineral$() which can be used to make $(l:mechanics/advanced_building_materials#alabaster)Alabaster$(). It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks.
Gypsum in Chalk.

pages.title: Halite
pages.text: Halite is a $(thing)Mineral$() which can be ground in the $(l:mechanics/quern)Quern$() to make $(thing)Salt$(), which is an important $(l:mechanics/decay#salting)Preservative$(). It can be found in very large flat deposits near the surface in $(l:the_world/geology#sedimentary)Sedimentary$() rocks.
Halite in Chalk.

pages.title: Emerald
pages.text: Emerald is a decorative $(l:mechanics/gems)Gemstone$(). It looks quite pretty, maybe if you could find someone else in this incredibly lonely world you could trade it with them...$(br2)It appears in thin vertical ore formations which can be up to a hundred blocks tall. It can be found in $(l:the_world/geology#igneous_intrusive)Igneous Intrusive$() rocks.
Emerald in Diorite.

pages.title: Kimberlite
pages.text: Kimberlite is a decorative and priceless $(l:mechanics/gems)Gemstone$(). It appears in thin vertical ore formations called $(l:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volcanic_pipe)Kimberlite Pipes$() which can be up to a hundred blocks tall. It can only be found in $(thing)Gabbro$().
Kimberlite in Gabbro.

pages.title: Lapis Lazuli
pages.text: Lapis Lazuli is a decorative $(thing)Mineral$() which can be used to make $(l:mechanics/dye)Blue Dye$(). It can be found in large, but sparse veins in $(thing)Limestone$() and $(thing)Marble$(), between y=-20 and y=80.
Lapis Lazuli in Marble.

pages.title: Amethyst
pages.text: Amethyst is a decorative $(thing)Mineral$() which can be used to make $(l:mechanics/glassworking)Glass$(). It can be found in $(thing)Sedimentary$() and $(thing)Metamorphic$() rock beneath rivers above y=40.
Amethyst in Marble.

pages.title: Opal
pages.text: Opal is a decorative $(thing)Mineral$(). It can be found in $(thing)Sedimentary) and $(thing)Igneous Extrusive$() rock beneath rivers above y=40.
Opal in Basalt.
